intro: Hoffmannia hidalgensis, commonly known as the Hidalgo hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a short lifespan and is often found in mountainous regions of the state of Hidalgo. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
